reg:regulation.reg:title:
Adult Guardianship
(Abuse and Neglect) Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 13/2011, September 1, 2011]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Adult Guardianship Act;
assessment means an assessment of whether an adult is incapable of deciding not to accept the services proposed in a support and assistance plan;
assessor means a person authorized by the Public Guardian and Trustee to do assessments;
support and assistance plan means a plan developed under section 51 (1) (g) of the Act;
trust company means a trust company, or extraprovincial trust corporation, authorized under the Financial Institutions Act to do trust business.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On being asked by a designated agency to arrange for an assessment, the Public Guardian and Trustee may arrange for the adult to be examined by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: one assessor if, because of geographic location or other special circumstances, it is not reasonable in the Public Guardian and Trustee's opinion to require a team of assessors.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The designated agency that asked for the assessment must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: allow an assessor to examine any records relevant to the assessment, and
provide any other assistance that is requested by an assessor and is necessary for completing the assessment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: When an adult is being assessed, at least one assessor must inform the adult that an assessment is being done and must explain the purpose.
Each assessor must follow the Practice Guidelines for Incapability Assessment.

If an adult refuses to participate in all or part of an assessment, the assessment may be performed using observational information and information gathered from other sources, if the assessor reasonably believes the assessment would be accurately completed by doing so.
When deciding whether the adult is incapable, an assessor must base the decision on whether the adult understands

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the services described in the support and assistance plan,
why the services are being offered to the adult, and
the consequences to the adult of not accepting the services.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In the course of an assessment, at least one assessor must consult with the persons specified in subsection (2) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the assessor has reason to believe that they can provide accurate information that is relevant to the assessment, and
the conditions applicable under that subsection are met.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the following persons are specified:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the adult's spouse, if the spouse has been in contact with the adult during the preceding 6 months and has no dispute with the adult;
available near relatives and friends of the adult if they

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are at least 19 years of age,
have been in contact with the adult during the preceding 12 months, and
have no dispute with the adult;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any person who has provided the adult with social services in the preceding 6 months;
any person who has provided the adult with health care in the preceding 6 months.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An assessor must, in writing, list the persons with whom the assessor consulted under subsection (1) and record the extent to which they were consulted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Presence of adult's spouse, near relative or friend
bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless the adult objects, an assessor may allow the spouse, a near relative or a friend of the adult to be present during the assessment to help the assessor to communicate with the adult.
On completing an assessment, the assessor or a member of the assessment team must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: advise the adult of the details and results of the assessment, and
provide to the adult's legal counsel, the designated agency that asked for the assessment and, if present during the assessment, the adult's spouse, near relative or friend

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: written information respecting the details and results of the assessment, and
a completed copy of the incapability assessment report in Form 1.

bcl:form.bcl:centertext: (This form to be completed by Authorized Assessors)
bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: I/We, the assessors(s) named below, confirm that I/We have assessed whether ..................................................................[name of adult] is incapable of deciding not to accept the services proposed in a support and assistance plan prepared by ..................................................[name of designated agency].

bcl:lefttext.in:strong: Our assessment is that the adult named above is

bcl:form.bcl:lefttext: [ ] Capable of deciding not to accept the services proposed in the support and assistance plan.
[ ] Not Capable of deciding not to accept the services proposed in the support and assistance plan.

bcl:lefttext.in:strong: The assessor(s) who conducted the assessment
